about.name: The following questions are from real DMV written tests. These are some of the actual permit questions you will face in California. Each permit practice test question has three answer choices. Select one answer for each question and select "grade this section." You can find this button at the bottom of the drivers license quiz.  For a complete list of questions and answers for California please visit https://cheat-sheets.dmv-written-test.com/en/california/car.

hasPart.name: You want to turn left at an upcoming corner. Yield the right-of-way to:

hasPart.text: When making a left turn, you must yield to pedestrians, bicyclists, or other vehicles moving on their green light.

comment.text: Oncoming vehicles also turning left.
All approaching vehicles.

suggestedAnswer.text: Pedestrians on the sidewalk waiting for a "Walk" signal.

comment.text: Pedestrians on the sidewalk waiting for a "Walk" signal.
All approaching vehicles.

answerExplanation.text: When making a left turn, you must yield to pedestrians, bicyclists, or other vehicles moving on their green light.

comment.text: You want to turn left at an upcoming corner. Yield the right-of-way to: | When making a left turn, you must yield to pedestrians, bicyclists, or other vehicles moving on their green light.

hasPart.name: When stopping on snow or ice, drivers who are operating vehicles equipped with an Anti-Lock Braking System (ABS) should:

about.name: When stopping on snow or ice, drivers who are operating vehicles equipped with an Anti-Lock Braking System (ABS) should:

hasPart.assesses: When stopping on snow or ice, drivers who are operating vehicles equipped with an Anti-Lock Braking System (ABS) should: | When stopping on snow or ice, drivers who are operating vehicles equipped with an Anti-Lock Braking System (ABS) should: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: When driving a vehicle equipped with an Anti-Lock Braking System (ABS), a driver should press the brake pedal firmly when stopping on a snowy or icy surface. The ABS will pump the brakes more rapidly than a driver would be able to.

comment.text: Pump the brakes.

suggestedAnswer.text: Press and hold the brake pedal firmly.

comment.text: Press and hold the brake pedal firmly.

suggestedAnswer.text: Stay off the brakes and wait for the car to drift to a stop.

comment.text: Stay off the brakes and wait for the car to drift to a stop.

acceptedAnswer.text: Press and hold the brake pedal firmly.

comment.text: Press and hold the brake pedal firmly.

answerExplanation.text: When driving a vehicle equipped with an Anti-Lock Braking System (ABS), a driver should press the brake pedal firmly when stopping on a snowy or icy surface. The ABS will pump the brakes more rapidly than a driver would be able to.

hasPart.name: When entering the interstate on a short entrance ramp where there is no acceleration lane, you should:

about.name: When entering the interstate on a short entrance ramp where there is no acceleration lane, you should:

hasPart.assesses: When entering the interstate on a short entrance ramp where there is no acceleration lane, you should: | When entering the interstate on a short entrance ramp where there is no acceleration lane, you should: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: When entering the interstate on a short entrance ramp where there is no acceleration lane, speed up only after you have identified a gap in traffic. In general, you should be stopped while waiting for a gap to appear.

suggestedAnswer.text: Immediately enter the far-right traffic lane on the interstate and speed up to match the flow of traffic.

comment.text: Immediately enter the far-right traffic lane on the interstate and speed up to match the flow of traffic.

suggestedAnswer.text: Use the shoulder of the main road to get up to the speed of traffic.

comment.text: Use the shoulder of the main road to get up to the speed of traffic.

suggestedAnswer.text: Speed up and enter the interstate only after you have identified a gap in traffic.

comment.text: Speed up and enter the interstate only after you have identified a gap in traffic.

acceptedAnswer.text: Speed up and enter the interstate only after you have identified a gap in traffic.

comment.text: Speed up and enter the interstate only after you have identified a gap in traffic.

answerExplanation.text: When entering the interstate on a short entrance ramp where there is no acceleration lane, speed up only after you have identified a gap in traffic. In general, you should be stopped while waiting for a gap to appear.

comment.text: When entering the interstate on a short entrance ramp where there is no acceleration lane, you should: | When entering the interstate on a short entrance ramp where there is no acceleration lane, speed up only after you have identified a gap in traffic. In general, you should be stopped while waiting for a gap to appear.

hasPart.name: You want to park downhill on a two-way road and there is no curb. Which way do you turn your front wheels?

about.name: You want to park downhill on a two-way road and there is no curb. Which way do you turn your front wheels?

hasPart.assesses: You want to park downhill on a two-way road and there is no curb. Which way do you turn your front wheels? | You want to park downhill on a two-way road and there is no curb. Which way do you turn your front wheels? -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: When parking facing downhill on a road with or without a curb, or when facing uphill on a road without a curb, turn your front wheels toward the edge of the road so your vehicle will roll away from traffic if the brakes fail. However, when parking uphill on a road with a curb, turn your wheels toward the center of the road so the vehicle will roll into the curb if the brakes fail.

comment.text: Straight ahead

suggestedAnswer.text: Right, toward the side of the road

comment.text: Right, toward the side of the road

suggestedAnswer.text: Left, toward the center of the road

comment.text: Left, toward the center of the road

acceptedAnswer.text: Right, toward the side of the road

comment.text: Right, toward the side of the road

answerExplanation.text: When parking facing downhill on a road with or without a curb, or when facing uphill on a road without a curb, turn your front wheels toward the edge of the road so your vehicle will roll away from traffic if the brakes fail. However, when parking uphill on a road with a curb, turn your wheels toward the center of the road so the vehicle will roll into the curb if the brakes fail.

comment.text: You want to park downhill on a two-way road and there is no curb. Which way do you turn your front wheels? | When parking facing downhill on a road with or without a curb, or when facing uphill on a road without a curb, turn your front wheels toward the edge of the road so your vehicle will roll away from traffic if the brakes fail. However, when parking uphill on a road with a curb, turn your wheels toward the center of the road so the vehicle will roll into the curb if the brakes fail.

hasPart.name: You must notify the DMV within five days if you:

about.name: You must notify the DMV within five days if you:

hasPart.assesses: You must notify the DMV within five days if you: | You must notify the DMV within five days if you: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: You are required by law to contact the DMV within five calendar days from the date you sell or transfer the title of a vehicle to another owner. They must be notified of every title transfer.

suggestedAnswer.text: Are cited for a traffic violation.

comment.text: Are cited for a traffic violation.
Sell or transfer your vehicle.

suggestedAnswer.text: Paint your vehicle a different color.

comment.text: Paint your vehicle a different color.
Sell or transfer your vehicle.

answerExplanation.text: You are required by law to contact the DMV within five calendar days from the date you sell or transfer the title of a vehicle to another owner. They must be notified of every title transfer.

comment.text: You must notify the DMV within five days if you: | You are required by law to contact the DMV within five calendar days from the date you sell or transfer the title of a vehicle to another owner. They must be notified of every title transfer.

hasPart.name: If you are involved in a traffic accident in California, you must file a report of the accident with the DMV when:

about.name: If you are involved in a traffic accident in California, you must file a report of the accident with the DMV when:

hasPart.assesses: If you are involved in a traffic accident in California, you must file a report of the accident with the DMV when: | If you are involved in a traffic accident in California, you must file a report of the accident with the DMV when: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: If a collision results in death, any minor or major injury, or more than $1,000 in damage to anyone's property, each driver involved must file a report with the DMV within 10 days. In some cases, the driver's insurance agent, broker, or legal representative may file the report to represent the driver.

comment.text: The collision causes $1,000 in damage.

suggestedAnswer.text: You plan on being out of the state for more than 30 days.

comment.text: You plan on being out of the state for more than 30 days.

suggestedAnswer.text: You refinance the remaining balance of your vehicle loan.

comment.text: You refinance the remaining balance of your vehicle loan.
The collision causes $1,000 in damage.

answerExplanation.text: If a collision results in death, any minor or major injury, or more than $1,000 in damage to anyone's property, each driver involved must file a report with the DMV within 10 days. In some cases, the driver's insurance agent, broker, or legal representative may file the report to represent the driver.

comment.text: If you are involved in a traffic accident in California, you must file a report of the accident with the DMV when: | If a collision results in death, any minor or major injury, or more than $1,000 in damage to anyone's property, each driver involved must file a report with the DMV within 10 days. In some cases, the driver's insurance agent, broker, or legal representative may file the report to represent the driver.
